abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and institutional development impacts
            substantial. Lessons drawn from the project suggest the
            following. The components of this operation emerged from
            within the Government's overall development strategy,
            which created ownership, and in turn recognized the extent
            of policymakers' consensus to prod the reform agenda.
            Moreover, participation of the civil society and the overall
            level of public trust is an important element for
            introducing radical reforms, and successful implementation
            of its process. Moreover, a clear and well defined
            assignment of responsibility within government entities
            specified and defined the boundaries of responsibility, and
            accountability for the implementation of various parts of
            the reform process. This further supported the achievement
            of program objectives, through a well coordinated effort
            among donors, both in terms of advice and activities so as
            to maximize synergies and improve cohesiveness. The
            importance of Government institutional and implementation
            capacity is emphasized, as a binding constraint for
            successful development, and implementation of each component
            of a reform program, and key to ensure sustainability of reforms
